definition[0]: a formal process in which people vote in order to show that they support someone or something, especially the government
example[0]: On April 19 the new government won a vote of confidence by 339 votes to 207.
definition[1]: something that you do or say that shows you support someone and approve of their actions
example[1]: The new investments are widely seen as a vote of confidence in the nationâ€™s economic future.
